New Records: India won by seven wickets to extend their winning start
Jasprit Bumrah finished with 2-36 for Pakistan but it seems to have come in for a lot of scrutiny from the pundits for his lack of bite up front
Key Match Events: India demolished Pakistan as the most eagerly awaited contest of the World Cup so far turned into a one-sided anti-climax in Ahmedabad
Pakistan had looked fairly comfortable at 155-2 after they asked to bat first by India
India began like a train in response with skipper Rohit Sharma plundering 86 off 63 balls
Pakistan's bowlers struggled to make inroads and eight wickets went down for 36 runs
Kuldeep Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah were instrumental in blowing Pakistan away
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted India as the favorites given their home advantage
Captain Babar Azam emphasized Pakistanâ€™s focus on improving their powerplay performance
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma: 'There is no doubt about it that the bowlers set up the game for us again today. It was a great effort.'
Babar Azam: 'We were not up to the mark with the new ball. If we had been, it might have been a different ball game.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game certainly didn't live up to the hype but it furthers our opinions and predictions that India are the team to beat at home in this World Cup
Fireworks light up the night sky in Ahmedabad
